channel.title: BBC News - Family & Education

item.title: Periods: TikTok gives better education than schools, say teens
item.description: Young women say they learn more about periods outside school as a report reveals shortcomings.

item.title: Spike in child hepatitis cases linked to common virus
item.description: UK child hepatitis cases rise to 108, with a common virus increasingly likely to be the trigger.

item.title: Teacher sacked for sending maskless vulnerable boy out of class
item.description: The teacher forgot she had sent the vulnerable 15-year-old out of the room, a tribunal report says.

item.title: Covid: Tain family ends more than two years self isolation
item.description: The Arthurs stayed at home to protect seven-year-old twins Orin and Olivia who have a rare disease.

item.title: Oxfordshire boy campaigns on climate change
item.description: Eight-year-old Joe has started a YouTube channel to help teach other children about climate change.

item.title: Ex-Nicholas Hammond Academy teacher banned after completing pupils' work
item.description: The pupils were unaware their assignments had been fabricated by their teacher, a report says.

item.title: Child Q: Strip-search schoolgirl head teacher steps down
item.description: The school's governing body says teachers were not aware a strip-search was taking place.

item.title: Mid-day meal plan struggles to feed India's hungry students
item.description: The world's most ambitious free school food programme resumes post pandemic, but problems remain.

item.title: When do parents find out about primary-school places?
item.description: Councils are contacting parents and carers with offers of primary-school places in England and Wales.

item.title: Online porn: 'My pupils ask me about violence'
item.description: Teachers are discussing how best to tackle pornography and its impact on children - and staff.

item.title: Syrian refugee retraining to become teacher in Wales
item.description: Inas wants to be a role model for those "who stop their life when they change their country".

item.title: Here's what you should know about student debt
item.description: What you need to know about student loan repayments - and how they differ from normal bank loans.

item.title: Covid: How will my exams be different this year?
item.description: What changes are being made to give pupils a fair chance after two years of disruption due to Covid?

item.title: Child Q impact: 'Our voices need to be heard'
item.description: A social justice charity is helping empower young black people after a girl was strip-searched in school.

item.title: 'Life without Covid rules is much worse than we thought'
item.description: Vaccines and treatments have helped many in the UK but Isabel, 11, is among those still at risk.

item.title: Local elections 2022: How do you get young people to vote?
item.description: About 300 students have been learning about politics as the local elections approach in Wales.

item.title: Ukraine war: Bringing up a baby among the bombs
item.description: More than 1.5 million children have fled Ukraine since the beginning of Russia's invasion, says the UN.

item.title: Coda star and Oscar nominee inspires deaf children to dream big
item.description: Troy Kotsur is a star of CODA and the first deaf male actor ever to be nominated for an Oscar.
